result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by T.S- JSC, DE currently has an outstanding balance with JSC. bph    To rg

filed and signed by DE and Atty, with WI Elements. bph

11:43 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Thomas James Evans in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Thomas James Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 16CT242, 22CF538 & 22TR446- all set for PTC. Court reviews file.  Atty Harrelson makes statements as to status of case, DE would like to PLEAD to Count 1 in 22CF306 and requesting a PSI. All other counts and cases will remain open for the time being. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- OWI 4th in 22CF306. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF306. Court merge and dismiss Count 4 in 22CF306.  Court reads in and dismisses count 2 & 3 in 22CF306 and 16CT242.  Court dismisses 22TR1333, not unreasonable.  Court remands DE, PSI is ordered.  Adjourned at 12:02 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:13 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas James Evans appears via zoom from Cedar Ridge.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson appeared by video for Thomas James Evans. Includes 16CT242, 22CF306, 22TR1333. Court reviews file. Atty Harrelson states he is trying to research cases and potentially will have a Collateral attack, notes Amended Information adding PAC to case 22CF306- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. Court questions DE on status at Cedar Ridge.  DE responds and gives address. Zoom approved for DE if he's still in treatment. Tina Sitz from JSC is here stating they haven't heard from him, requesting to have appropriate releases.  Court advises DE to make sure to sign releases.  Adjourned at 9:27 AM. bph

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF306 and 16CT242

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 3 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF306 (INIT) and 16CT242 (RW):
  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Thomas James Evans appeared from jail. DE qualifies for PD services. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court will QUASH WARRANT in 16CT242. Atty Dippolito states DE completed a Rule 25. Waiting for a bed to open to begin inpatient treatment again. Currently in outpatient. Court may reconsider bond at preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
